headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: Russia: Chechen Rebel Goes On Trial

lead_paragraph: The highest-ranking Chechen guerrilla ever captured by Russian forces went on trial with three other rebels in Dagestan, a southwestern province bordering Chechnya. Salman Raduyev is charged with leading an attack on a Dagestani town in 1996 in which 70 people died and 2,000 were taken hostage. Mr. Raduyev fought mostly in the first Chechen war, in the mid-1990's; he has played little role in the second war, which began in 1999 and continues today. Michael Wines (NYT)
